speaker: FRIAR JOHN
content: Friar John calls out for Friar Lawrence, addressing him as a fellow Franciscan friar.

speaker: FRIAR LAWRENCE
content: Friar Lawrence recognizes Friar John's voice and asks for news from Romeo in Mantua, or for a letter if Romeo wrote down his thoughts.

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
content: He explains that while searching for another friar to accompany him, the town health inspectors quarantined them in a house suspected of plague, preventing his journey to Mantua.

speaker: FRIAR LAWRENCE
content: He urgently asks who then delivered his letter to Romeo.

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
content: He replies that he could not send the letter or find a messenger because everyone was too afraid of catching the plague.

speaker: FRIAR LAWRENCE
content: He exclaims at the unlucky event, noting the letter was not trivial but urgent and important; neglecting it may cause great harm. He orders Friar John to fetch an iron crowbar immediately.

speaker: FRIAR JOHN
content: He agrees to go and bring the crowbar.

speaker: FRIAR LAWRENCE
content: He resolves to go alone to the tomb where Juliet will wake in three hours; she will be angry Romeo wasn't informed, so he'll write again and shelter her until Romeo arrivesâ€”a living body enclosed in a dead man's tomb.
